title: Aggretsuko season 2
body:
Haida is still bestest of bois

Feneko needed more screen time

Anai is one bad day and a few million dollars away from becoming Patrick Bateman

Tadano is a good boi but his whole post-modernism “i can change society in 30 years and marriage is an illusion” mentality reaaaaally rubs me the wrong way

Retsuko deserves a hug

9/10 i probly enjoyed season 1 more in relatability but this one felt more focused on its storyline

tags: if anyone doesn't like my take feel free to move on
summary: It seems like quite a few people are defending Tadano like he did nothing wrong. Here’s the thing, he’s a nonsense person, he...
body:
It seems like quite a few people are defending Tadano like he did nothing wrong. Here’s the thing, he’s a nonsense person, he would be an incredibly difficult person to hold a relationship with in general, never mind the whole marriage thing -we will get to that too however.

Innovators tend to be about 100% efficiency in getting to their goals and such a mindset tends to sacrifice some touch with humanity to achieve that (what I mean when I say ‘nonsense person’.) An example of this in fiction would be Griffith from Berserk. An example from real life would be Elon Musk. (not 100% matches mind you, just similar personalities and mindset). There is little perspective to what “other’s” worldviews are like. They are focused on their inner worldview. For better or worse. Which also boils down to potentially ignoring the thoughts and feelings of others.

P.s.: Nonsense person also means someone that makes a 2 and a half hour to 3 hour trip, there and back, to go to One Specific ramen bar on a First date’s worknight…

Also p.s.: to clarify “nonsense person” is not intended as a bad statement but rather a descriptor. The person writing this is definitely a nonsense person sometimes too…so yeah..that’s how I know…

Let me list some things here about what Tadano did wrong with Retsuko

-Didn’t defend Retsuko from online harassment.

It makes sense that a guy that lives so carefree would not understand the importance of making a small statement (at least) on how they met, online. Or at least on how serious such comments hurt and better console/comfort Retsuko rather than essentially “suck it up”.

-Lives in his car…?

Dudes and dudettes. There is nothing healthy about living in a car. This coming from a person that has had to sleep in a car sometimes. It’s bad for the back, and the body. Though I do imagine his limo is comfier, it’s not a substitute for an actual room. There was little space and it was dark. Which leads to the next part.

-Lives an unhealthy lifestyle.

The main reason Tadano has a bad sleep habit is that he has little structure. Part of the reason some people like their jobs is that it gives them that structure!. It’s necessary for your body to move each day. And its GOOD for your mind to socialize with people, even occasionally people one might dislike. Because people are social animals. Anyways I can say it with certainty since when he got with retsuko, her structure helped him get actual sleep.

-Making Retsuko miss work

Did Tadano even help her pay her bills and rent…?

-Asking her to QUIT her job

They haven’t been dating that long, and neither does he want to get married. This is incredibly risky for the person -not- working. Suddenly there is a huge power imbalance in the relationship. One wrong, disliked move, and instead it would be retsuko broken up with, and now, without a job… Quite frankly asking her to quit her job is on par with marriage in severity. At least a partner that is aware of relationships and how they work would only ask this when the relationship is for sure, on a serious level.

P.S. On a related note, not saying Tadano would abuse her cause he seemed nice enough, just saying IRL this is how some domestic abusers control their partners. I’m saying this cause if some guy like Tadano comes trying to sweep you off your feet and saying “don’t work, quit your job” RIGHT OFF THE GET GO…THATS A HUGE RED FLAG. The chances of that working out are like winning the lottery, more often that’s not gonna work out for you. There has to be a real foundation of trust there for it to work. Which this also leads me too…

-Doesn’t want to get married, no discussion

Hey, I’m not sure whats behind it exactly. But a person that is 100% deadset against marriage is DIFFERENT from a person that’s “against the idea of marriage but would do it under the right circumstances”. This is pure relationship wisdom talking tho, so you can take it with a grain of salt, just imo a relationship working out with this type of mindset is also like trying to win the lottery. Most people that are 100% against marriage -no discussion -no possibility, aren’t romantics at heart, and see love in a much more casual way, or were freaking HURT and therefore need to heal. They can get along well with others like them I suppose.

Anyways this is all coming from someone that loved Tadano as a character. I agree with some of his views. Just as an older and wiser person I also understand he’s not fully mature and possibly will never mature if he doesn’t get advice and perspective from the “more grounded folk” of the world. We call that getting a more well-rounded world perspective. Just look at Elon Musk. (haha, I say that as part joke but also part …not)

I hope this helps some of the inexperienced people out there have some more understanding of the complexities that go into relationships. Cause I don’t want anyone out there sacrificing themselves for someone that “seems cool”. Retsuko is a pretty tough cookie to know what she wants to be honest.

summary: Well watching season 2 of aggretsuko is giving me serious anxiety issues
body:
Well watching season 2 of aggretsuko is giving me serious anxiety issues

The new character making aggretsuko feel so hopeless, and the fact he makes that face where his teeth dig into his mouth and his eyes get all bloodshot

I don’t think imma be able to finish this season…

tags: also Haida still best boi fight me
summary: Aggretsuko season 2: My two cents on Tadano.
title: Aggretsuko season 2: My two cents on Tadano.
body:
Season 2 was pretty good huh? Sure it wasn’t as fun as the first but it felt more focused, but we’re not here to talk about that, I wanna talk about the one thing.

Tadano and Retsuko.

Right, a few things to highlight before I start: The break up wasn’t Tadano’s fault, or rather not entirely his fault. There’s no bad guy here, and just like her previous relationship, there’s nothing “toxic” going on.

The break up hinged on one specific thing, that is that Retsuko wanted to get married, and Tadano doesn’t. Sure, it’s a bit more complicated then that, but that’s the heart of the matter.

Retsuko and Tadano have a genuine relationship, they can talk to each other, joke around, and overall feel more or less comfortable being themselves around each other. They honestly do care for one another, love each other even.

Tadano is not a bad guy, a bit lazy sure, but he listens to Restuko, talks honestly with her, and has a pretty noble goal in mind with his work. But he’s also set in his beliefs, and that can make him dismissive. Insensitive, even.

Retsuko asks him what people are supposed to do after his A.I does its thing, and he says he hasn’t thought that far, and when she asks what SHE is going to do, he says he’ll just take care of her.

When news breaks of their relationship, he shrugs off the press, but doesn’t seem concerned with how Retsuko is handling it, saying it doesn’t matter. When she has doubts about going to work, Tadano states that her work can go on without her, seemingly unaware of how…tactless that could sound.

Then, the wedding thing.

Season 2 focused on one thing, that is Retsuko asking herself one simple question: “What do I want?” She has her doubts, and it takes a bit of stumbling, but she reaches her answer. She wants to get married. Not someone that her mother picked out, but someone SHE wants, that she cares for.

She wants to be a wife, and a mother, and when the press suggests she and Tadano might get married, she’s ecstatic. It’s literally the only thing keeping her going as news sites slam her for being a gold digger and attack her character.

Then Tadano says that “Marriage is a meaningless thing.”

Retsuko wants to get married, Tadano said that marriage is meaningless, that what Retsuko wants more then anything, is meaningless. He didn’t mean it like that, because he didn’t know Retsuko wanted that, because she didn’t tell him that, but he doesn’t think before he says it, never considers her opinion differs from his.   

Of course Retsuko thinks the same way he does, she doesn’t want that, why would anyone want that nowadays? He’s so set in his opinion about the matter he doesn’t consider another option, doesn’t think about what Retsuko feels about it.

Retsuko loves him, and he loves her, Retsuko almost gave up the one thing she wanted because he gave her everything else, but Ton gave her some harsh advise, and from there the path was set.

She wanted to get married, she wants to get married to Tadano, settle in and raise a family with him. She tells him as much, Death metal and no, in no uncertain terms.

Tadano tries to convince her that she doesn’t want that, not really, it doesn’t mean anything, it isn’t worth anything, why does it matter?

Because it matters to her, that’s why. 

They both have a right to want what they want out of life, and breaking up because they disagree about where life will take them is understandable.

Retsuko needed to talk to Tadano more openly about it, Tadano needed to get out of his own head to ask Retsuko what she wanted.

She didn’t, he didn’t.

So, they broke up.

Sad, yeah, but somethings can make or break a relationship, but they both get what they want in the end, in a way.
body_abstract:
Season 2 was pretty good huh? Sure it wasn’t as fun as the first but it felt more focused, but we’re not here to talk about that, I wanna talk about the one thing.

Tadano and Retsuko.

summary:
That cute dog lady that appears in season 2 of Aggretsuko that doesn't have a name. 

I like to call her Kyabaria or just Kya...
caption: That cute dog lady that appears in season 2 of Aggretsuko that doesn’t have a name. I like to call her Kyabaria or just Kya from the japan name of the species Cavalier King Charles spaniel ( Kyabariakinguchāruzusupanieru )

summary: Another show! This time I watched Aggretsuko! ^ ^
body:
Another show! This time I watched Aggretsuko! ^ ^

To be fair I only started because darn it, if I need a distraction from having Ninjago and Final Space with new seasons but not being able to watch them (not in English the first, not on a server I can use the second. Life sucks 😢). So yeah, dear old pal Netflix gave me this and I was like “Why the heck not?”

It was definitely the cutest until now, which is crazy since It’s about capitalism, work situations and startups, stuff that I even studied for university! And honestly, it can get surprisingly emotional and actually real? Especially season 2, with some great new characters 👍👍👍

I love the protagonist, you kinda wanna root for her 🧡🧡🧡 And my favorite, Haida, apparently is recognized as an universal treasure so I’m more than happy 😍

Go have a look for something cute, funny and also that can make you think. Especially when you reflect about growing up, being an adult…

See ya! 💜

(Tagging some of my fandoms as usual)

blog.name: auntie-diluvian
blog.title: haha, whoops.
blog.description: I'm jerjj and I have some stuff on AO3. I guess partially it's about romancing a skeleton, but MOSTLY I'd say it's about the care and keeping of notable cultural artifacts, the consequences of losing cold weather accessories, adequate lab safety practices, the importance of keeping a secure workplace, and, on occasion, Jerry.

tags: do you ever KNOW a post is a mistake and make it anyway

Tadano from Aggretsuko is just Sans...
